trans-unit.source: Defines the interface that associates a channel with a specific type of session.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISessionChannel%601> interface is the base interface for session-based channels.

It associates the type of session with the channel by setting the generic type parameter `TSession` to a type that implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession> interface in a way that reflects its role in the message exchange.

For example, the `TSession` is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputSession> for an incoming session on the receiving side of a one-way communication, to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputSession> for an outgoing session on the sending side of a one-way communication, and to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IDuplexSession> for a duplex session for a bi-directional communication pattern.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISessionChannel%601> interface provides a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISessionChannel%601.Session%2A> property to retrieve the session with which the channel is associated.
The type of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession"></xref> associated with the cannel.
Gets the type of session associated with this channel.
This returns the generic parameter `TSession` used to define the interface.
The type of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISession"></xref> associated with this channel.
